name: ITP-001 - Stripping Topsoil Clearing and Grubbing
template name: ITP-001 - Stripping Topsoil Clearing and Grubbing

name: 1.1 - Confirm understanding of current EMP related to the work area and that all prescribed environmental controls are in place
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: All environmental measures to be implemented as per current EMP and local authorities. Sediment control measures to be installed and protected vegetation to be clearly identified
INSPECTION/TEST METHOD: Document review & Site inspection
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP Signed
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Current GPP signed and specific for the area where works will be executed. Services in the work area are identified
INSPECTION/TEST METHOD: Document review & Site inspection
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: Excavation Permit Signed

ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Prior to removing any vegetation or habitat, the Contractor shall arrange an on-site inspection with the Superintendent and other relevant authorities to confirm and clearly identify and mark trees, vegetation or habitat to be removed. Any removal shall be consistent with the Contract drawings and any relevant permits and shall fence and sign all sites nominated as No-Go Zones.
REFERENCE DOCUMENTS: Project Spec. 176.I1 & Vicroads Spec.201
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: Extent of Clearing and Grubbing reviewed by Superintendent
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: The Contractor shall obtain all necessary permits and obtain approval from the Superintendent prior to the pruning or removal of local native vegetation.
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: Copy of issued permits
1.5 - Identification of Cultural Heritage sites and areas of Cultural Significance
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Areas determined to be No-Go Zones are securely fenced and clearly identified by signage installed in the fencing.
○ Immediately stop work and notify the Superintendent if any Cultural Heritage is discovered or identified during construction.
○ Works may recommence with the cultural heritage approval or if works can resume without risk to the discovered Cultural Heritage.
INSPECTION/TEST METHOD: Document review & Site inspection
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: Cultural Heritage approval (when required), Signed ITP
2.1 - Stripping of topsoil and grubbing of vegetation
FREQUENCY: Prior and after commencement of any ground disturbing activities

ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: In areas where excavation will be made, all vegetation, refuse and obstructions shall be totally grubbed or grubbed to a depth of not less than 0.3 m below the subgrade and batters, whichever is the lesser treatment.

○ In areas to be covered by embankments, to a depth of not less than 0.3 m below the stripped surface or not less than 0.6 m below the finished surface of the subgrade, whichever is the lesser treatment.
○ Holes resulting from grubbing shall be backfilled with material similar to the surrounding material and compacted to the same degree as the surrounding material
FREQUENCY: Prior to commencing this work
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Removal and disposal of abandoned services and obsolete underground drainage lines which interfere with the execution of works has been done.
○ Verify service is not likely to contain a hazardous material (sewage, asbestos pipe)
○ Decommissioned services to be disposed of in a suitable manner.
○ Decommissioned pits have been broken back to 0.3 metres below subgrade level.
○ Remaining pipe openings shall be sealed with concrete. Any remnants of pits shall be backfilled with material and compacted to a density ratio of not less than 95%
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Clearing work shall not be undertake outside of the specified and approved limits of work.

○ Tree branches extending over the carriageway shall be trimmed by a suitably qualified arborist to provide a clearance of at least 6 m above the carriageway surface.  Where whole branches are to be removed,  the three cut method shall be used.
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Tree trunks and large branches shall be removed from the site.
○ Small tree branches, shrubs and leaves, excluding noxious weeds, shall be disposed of by chipping and mulching to form mulch.
○ Disposal of noxious weeds shall be in acordance with the CaLP permit
REFERENCE DOCUMENTS: VicRoads Spec. 201.07, CaLP Permit
The signature below verifies that this ITP has been completed in accordance with the FH’s Quality system Procedures and verifies lot compliance with specifications.
1.1 - Check that current revision drawings are being used
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Issued For Construction (IFC) and latest available revision used
REFERENCE DOCUMENTS: Project Drawings / Drawing Register
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: Latest Revision Drawings
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Current Excavation Permit signed and specific for the area where works will be executed.
1.3 - Confirm understanding of current Environment Management Plan (EMP) related to the work area and that all prescribed environemental controls are in place
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: All environmental measures to be implemented as per current EMP and local authorities. Sediment control measures to be installed and protected vegetation to be clearly identified
INSPECTION/TEST METHOD: Document review & Site inspection
1.4 - Safety measures are in place, Safe Work Method Statement (SWMS) undertaken
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: As per Fulton Hogan Safety Strategy. All personnel on site to have signed onto relevant SWMS before commencing work.
REFERENCE DOCUMENTS: Health and Safety Coordination Plan

ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Survey activities undertaken to ensure and validate that all works meet level and location requirements. The establishment and integrity of the survey network shall be verified before commencing any survey and setout activity. IFC and latest available revision used.
○ The boxing width shall not be less than specified or shown on the drawings and the edges of boxing shall not deviate by more than 50 mm from the designed offset from the centreline or design line.
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: Survey records & pegs on the ground
FREQUENCY: Prior to (and during) Excavation of any new areas

ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Prior to commencing excavation in any area and during excavation work, the Superintendent and the Contractor shall inspect each type of material encountered and subject to verification by appropriate laboratory testing, agree on the category of the material in accordance with clause 204.04.
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: Area reviewed by Superintendent and Contractor, Signed ITP
FREQUENCY: Prior to Construction of Subbase Layer
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Where groundwater or seepage is encountered the Contractor shall notify the Superintendent and submit the proposed action to be taken to the Superintendent for review.
○ The Contractor shall submit any necessary approvals from relevant authorities for the treatment and disposal of this groundwater.
INSPECTION/TEST METHOD: Site Inspection/ Document Review
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: Area reviewed by Superintendent, Signed ITP
FREQUENCY: Prior to Construction of Subbase Layer
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Prior to construction of the regulating layer, the areas of rock subgrade shall be presented to the Superintendent for acceptance.
○ The Contractor shall submit details of any necessary amendments to the subsurface drainage design including transverse subsurface drainage at the interfaces to the Superintendent for review.

○ No adjustment to the Contract Sum will be considered for the treatment of a rock subgrade, or for the construction of the regulating layer in lieu of capping or selected material, or for any modifications to the subsurface drainage.
INSPECTION/TEST METHOD: Site Inspection/ Document Review
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: Superintendent acceptance, Signed ITP
FREQUENCY: Prior to Construction of Subbase Layer
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Areas upon which fills are to be constructed, all layers of fill, and material within 150 mm of the cut floor level in cuts, shall be test rolled in accordance with Section 173.
○ Superintendent to be present during all test rolling.
○ Fulton Hogan to provide not less than 24hrs notice to the Superintendent of the location and commencement time for test rolling. Superintendent to be present during all test rolling.
○ No fill or subbase materials are to be placed on the prepared areas until the the area has been reviewed by the Superintendent.
○ Where unsuitable material is encountered the Contractor shall propose in situ treatment and depth of excavation to the Superintendent for review.
○ No fill shall be placed against or within 3 m of a structure until the foundation for the fill has been reviewed by the Superintendent.
○ Where <10% of the lot area is deemed unsuitable, material shall be rectified as agreed by the Contractor and Superintendent
REFERENCE DOCUMENTS: VicRoads Specification  Cl. 204.12, Cl.173.03, Cl. 204.10(b), Cl. 204.07(d), Cl.204.11
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: Area visually reviewed by Superintendent, Signed ITP
FREQUENCY: Prior to Construction of Subbase Layer
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Ensure the Cut Floor Level is recorded by survey
REFERENCE DOCUMENTS: VicRoads Specification  Cl. 204.03(f), Cl. 204.03(g) Table 204.031

ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: If exacavated material is to be reused as Type A or B material, the Superintendent and the Contractor shall inspect the material encountered and subject to verification by appropriate laboratory testing, agree on the category of the material in accordance with clause 204.04.
○ Type B Material shall meet the following requirements:
REFERENCE DOCUMENTS: VicRoads Specification  Cl. 204.04, Cl. 204.06
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: Test Results, Material Category agreed with Superintendent
The signature below verifies that this ITP has been completed in accordance with the FH’s Quality system Procedures and verifies lot compliance with specifications.
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Ensure that all employees and subcontractors are using the correct, complete and most up-to-date revision of the design drawings.
REFERENCE DOCUMENTS: Drawings and Drawings Register

ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Crushed rock mixes proposed for use on specified works shall be registered in accordance with VicRoads Code of Practice for Registration of Crushed Rock Mix Designs as listed in Section 175.
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: Mix Design Approval
1.3 - Implementation of all measures and controls
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: All necessary measures and controls are being implemented before commencing work, that is: EMP, ECP, QMP, SWMS.
REFERENCE DOCUMENTS: IFC Drawings EMP, ECP, ERA, QMP, SWMS.
INSPECTION/TEST METHOD: Document review & Site inspection
FREQUENCY: Check prior to placing material
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Material should be spread to minimize number of joints.
○ Transverse joints shall be offset from one layer to next by not less than 2 metres
○ Transverse joints shall be offset from one layer to the next by not less than 2 m.
REFERENCE DOCUMENTS: VicRoads Spec. Cl.304.07 (a, b & c)
FREQUENCY: Check prior to placing material
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Material should be spread to minimize number of joints.
○ longitudinal joints shall be offset from one layer to the next by not less than 150 mm.
○ longitudinal joints shall be located within 300 mm of the planned position of traffic lanes lines or within 300 mm of the centre of a traffic lane.
REFERENCE DOCUMENTS: VicRoads Spec. Cl.304.07 (a, d & e)
FREQUENCY: Check prior to placing material
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: A single lot shall be considered a single layer of 4000m2 or one day's production in a single layer, whichever is lesser.
○ For pavement construction, any lot that has a surface area less than 500 m2 may be treated as a small area and tested in accordance with Section 173.
REFERENCE DOCUMENTS: VicRoads Spec. Cl.304.08 (b)(ii & iv) Table 304.111

ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: The maximum thickness of any pavement base layer shall not exceed 150mm and the maximum thickness of any subbase layer shall not exceed 200mm. The minimum thickness of any pavement layer shall be 4 times the nominal size of the material.
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: The Contractor shall provide for the Superintendent to be present during all test rolling.
○ No visible deformation or spinging in presence of Superintendent's representative.
○ Proof rolling plant to comply with requirements of Cl. 173.03.
○ The placement of the Upper Base Layer shall not proceed until the Superintendent is satisifed with the release of this Hold Point.
REFERENCE DOCUMENTS: VicRoads Spec.  Cl. 173, Cl.304.09
3.1 - Determine Testing Scale & Initial testing frequency
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Table 204.161 from VicRoads Standard nominates the level of testing required for acceptance of Surface Level Measurement.

○ Scale A - Initially test every lot until 3 consecutive lots of like material and/or work have achieved the standards specified in Clauses 304.08. and 304.10.  If no failures, Reduced Frequency applies as specified in Table 304.111.
○ VicRoads Specification Cl.304.08 (a), Cl.304.11 (b), Cl.304.11 (c)(i) Table 304.111
INSPECTION/TEST METHOD: Document Review/ Site Inspection
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Characteristic Value of Density Ratio for Subbase:- > 98.0% for Scale A and >97.0% for Scale B.
○ For work to be tested for compliance with Scale A or Scale B requirements, the number of tests per lot shall be six.
REFERENCE DOCUMENTS: VicRoads Specification  Cl. 304.08 (b) (iii) Table 304.081
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Class 4 Crushed rock max 5x10^-9 m/sec. Class 3  Crushed rock max 5x10^-7 m/sec

○ Where the Class 4 material is used as a levelling layer in a deep strength asphalt pavement, the Superintendent grants dispensation from 5x10-9 m/s Max permeability requirement in clause 3040.05(a) and table 3040.051
REFERENCE DOCUMENTS: Project Specification Cl.3040.05(a) Table 3040.051
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: Test Records from Supplier
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Post- compaction Plasticity Index must comply with the requirement of table 3040.053. Calss 3: 0 <  PI < 10.
REFERENCE DOCUMENTS: Project Specification Cl.3040.05(a) Table 3040.053
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: Test Records from Supplier
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: The post compaction grading shall comply with the requirements of table 304.101
REFERENCE DOCUMENTS: VicRoads Specification  Cl. 304.10 Table 304.101
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: Test Records from Supplier
— Minimum number of measurements per lot: 80 For Upper
— Upper Subbase: Mean + 4mm to - 8mm with a maximum Standard Deviation of 8mm
— Lower Subbase: Mean +6mm to -10mm with a maximum Standard Deviation of 10mm.
— Base: Mean ± 5 with  a maximum Standard Deviation of 8mm.
REFERENCE DOCUMENTS: VicRoads Specification Table 304.061, Table 304.062

ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: A complying test Certificate shall be provided to the Superintendent at least 5 days prior to installation, certifying that pit access covers have been tested and certified by a NATA accredited laboratory as complying with the requirements of AS 3996 and DTP.
○ Drainage pipes and culverts supplied in accordance with 701 and AS/NZS 4058.
○ Drainage Pits are supplied in accordance with 705.07.
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP signed
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Bedding Materials comply with Table 701.081 and 701.082.
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP signed
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Select and Ordinary Backfill Materials comply with tables 701.081 and 701.082
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP signed
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Material inspection to be completed for all precast pits, pipes, beaching and culverts.
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP signed
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Current GPP signed and specific to the area where works will be executed. Including walk through of the work area with the site team and GPP Coordinator prior to works.
INSPECTION/TEST METHOD: Document review & Site inspection
FREQUENCY: Prior to commencing drainage line
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Prior to commencement of excavation for the culverts and stormwater drainage, confirm the position with the Superintendent.
REFERENCE DOCUMENTS: VicRoads Spec. Cl. 701.10 IFC Drawing
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: Design and survey setout postion confirmed with Superintendent.
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Ensure trench is excavated to prepare culvert foundation and specified depth of bedding.

○ Pipe culverts: the width of trench at and below the level of the top of the pipe shall be such that the horizontal clearance from the outside of the pipe to the wall of the trench is greater than >300mm, less than <600mmm.
○ Pits: Clearance from external faces of the pit to each face of the excavation to be not less than 400mm
REFERENCE DOCUMENTS: VicRoads Spec. Cl. 701.15 Table 701.151, Cl. 705.05(b)
INSPECTION/TEST METHOD: Site Inspection, Measurements of trench
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Bedding material shall be provided and placed for the full width of the trench. The compacted thickness of bedding material following any shaping necessary shall be:
— minimum 200mm for pipes with D ≥ 1500 mm
○ 'D' is the nominal pipe diameter or culvert width.
○ Bedding and backfill materials shall be placed and compacted in layers not exceeding 150 mm loose thickness.
○ Once culvert sections are in position, an additional layer of bedding material is placed to a height equal to 30% of the nominal pipe diameter or culvert height.
○ Bedding material which has a swell equal to or greater than 2.5% shall be maintained at a mean moisture ratio of 92% between the completion of rolling and the placement of the overlying layer.
REFERENCE DOCUMENTS: VicRoads Spec.  Cl. 701.16, Cl. 701.20(a)
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Rebate and socket ends of pipe sections are positioned facing upstream and are to be fully entered. (Laying from downstream)

○ The lower portion of the pipe shall be in contact with the bedding for the full length of each section.  The compacted bedding shall be shaped to accommodate the joint collar and ensure that the pipe is supported along its full length.
○ Where applicable, the top of the pipe as marked shall be within five degrees of the vertical axis of the culvert.
○ Spacing of multiple rows of culverts to reflect Table 701.171.

ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Rubber Ring Joints (RRJs) jointed with rubber rings which have been kept undisturbed, clean, and free from dirt and other foreign materials and shall be stored undercover if pipes are not to be installed immediately.
○ RRJs assembled and prepared in accordance with the manufacturer’s recommendations.
INSPECTION/TEST METHOD: Document review/ Site Inspection
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: Manufacturer’s recommendations, ITP signed
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: The location of each run of underground drainage has been verified by a survey pickup prior to backfill and form the as constructed survey.
(a) offset of entry pits required to match lines of kerbs or barriers +/-20mm
(b) plan location of pits other than offsets to kerb lines or barriers +/-100mm
(c) Invert leve of pipes at pits +/-50mm whilst maintaining required drainage grade.
(d) Departure from design grade of pipe runs +/-10mm in 10m provided minimum grade is not less than 1:250
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Culvert Under Area to be Paved:

— Where the trench has been excavated from design subgrade level or above, the trench is backfilled to design subgrade level with selected backfill material, and above that level with appropriate pavement material.
— Where the trench is excavated from below design subgrade level the trench is filled with selected backfill material.
○ Culvert Under Area not to be Paved:
— The trench is backfilled with selected backfill material to a level 300mm above the top of the culvert and with ordinary backfill material above that level.
2.8 - Construction of Rock Apron at Concrete Headwalls
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Rock for Type 1 beaching shall consist of field or quarry rock.
○ All rocks shall have a mass of between 20 and 70 kg and at least 60% by number shall be over 40 kg.  Rocks shall be of such size that the layer of beaching is not less than 225 mm thick.
○ Rock apron to be installed as per design drawings.
FREQUENCY: Each culvert prior to construction of pavement layers

ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: All drainage lines constructed shall be inspected, after completion of earthworks to subgrade level and prior to construction of pavement layers, by an independent testing organisaiton using closed circuit television (CCTV) to verify that the flow of water is not obstructed by waste construction material left inside and to check for visible signs of defects.
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: Inspection Report, ITP signed
RESPONSIBILITY: Site Engineer / Site Foreman / Superintendent

ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: The Contractor shall submit details of proposed rectification treatments including manufacturer's product specifications and warranties, the area and thickness of repair treatment, detailed repair procedures, and inspection and test plans.
○ No repairs shall be undertaken without the Superintendent's approval of the repair materials and procedures.
INSPECTION/TEST METHOD: Document Review/ Site Inspection
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: Latest IFC Drawing, ITP signed
RESPONSIBILITY: Site Engineer / Site Foreman / Superintendent
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Bedding assessed for compaction and /or moisture in lots.
○ Bedding compacted to refusal with handheld mechanical equipment with a mean moisture ratio of 92%.
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: Compaction and moisture Test Records, ITP signed
FREQUENCY: 3 test per lot. (1 lot consists of one layer of bedding for a culvert length between pits or endwalls)
○ Min. 20% of all lots for each culvert shall be tested.
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Backfill assessed for compaction and or moisture in lots.
○ Backfill material which will have a nominal size after compaction of 40mm or < less compacted to a mean value of density ratio of not less than 97%.
○ Backfill material which has a swell equal to or greater > than 2.5% maintained at a mean moisture ratio of 92% between the completion of rolling and the placement of the overlying layer.
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: Compaction and moisture Test Records, ITP signed
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Each culvert flushed clean from end to end on completion and maintained in proper working order.

ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Where no fines concrete is used as filter material the Contractor shall submit quality procedures for review by the Superintendent which detail the method of placing the no-fines concrete. The method of compaction shall be in accordance with the Contractor's quality procedures
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP signed off
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Subsurface drainage pipes: 100mm DIA Class 1000 corrugated perforated plastic pipe with a perforation size of maximum 1.5mm width and minimum length of 150 mm per m^2.
○ Granular filter material for bedding and backfill: Trench backfilled with no fines concrete filter medium complying with  Cl 702.05

○ No Fines Concrete: No fines concrete shall consist of Type GP cement, water and coarse aggregate. The quantity of cement used shall be 4.0% by volume. Type GP Cement, water and coarse aggregate shall comply with the requirement of Section 703.
○ Subsurface drain pits: All subsurface drain pits shall be Type S1 to the specification of SD 1611
○ Pit Lids: Type M3 circular lid (as per SD 1051) for Type S1 pit
○ Flushout risers: Constructed to the detail of SD 1631
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP signed off
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Subsurface drains, whether pipe or geocomposite systems, shall be constructed true to line, level and depth, as shown on the drawings.
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP Signed Off
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: An excavation permit must be issued prior to any excavation commencing.
○ Plant and equipment shall be appropriate for the task.
○ Excavation operations shall not disturb areas outside the limit of excavation
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP Signed Off

ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Bottom of trench shall be compacted and at a depth no more than 50mm below the specified pipe invert. Grade of the base of the trench shall not allow ponding of water Any loose material shall be removed.
○ The base of the trench shall be inspected by the Superintendent prior to placing bedding in completed excavations.
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP signed off
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Bedding of granular filter material of thickness between 25 mm and 50mm placed across bottom of trench and screeded or graded to level
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP signed off
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Pipes placed centrally in trench and held firmly in place positioned with openings at the lower half of the pipe.
○ If geofabric required as per Cl 3030.07 (subsurface drains installed in expansive materials), minimum width of geotextile used for wrapping is 450 mm
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP signed off
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Granular filter material placed and compacted compacted in layers not exceeding 300mm with minimal disturbance to pipes.
○ No-fines concrete is to be placed and compacted within one hour of mixing and is to be compacted in accordance with the approved quality procedure.
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP signed off
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: The method of compaction shall be in accordance with the Contractor's quality procedures and shall be submitted for review by the Superintendent.
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP signed off
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Installed in accordance with drawings and Cl 702.10
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP signed off

ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Flushing test shall be witnessed by a representative nominated by the superintendent and shall confirm that the drainage line is free of obstruction. To be complete after installation of kerb and channel, barriers and road furniture.
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: Signed ITP/ Record of flushing tests

ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Placement of asphalt shall not proceed until the CCTV inspection and flushing test have been completed, damaged or deformed subsurface drainage pipe has been removed and replaced and the waste and defects free condition of subsurface drainage lines has been verified by the Superintendent.
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: Signed ITP/ Record of flushing tests

1.3 - Submission & Approval of Concrete Mix Design
FREQUENCY: Prior to first concrete pour

ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: The Contractor shall submit the concrete mix design details for review by the Superintendent not less than 4 weeks prior to the placement of concrete.  Concrete shall not be placed until the mix design has been reviewed by the Superintendent, and allocated a registration number on the Register of VicRoads approved concrete mixes.
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: ITP Signed, Mix design approval

ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: The Superintendent will review and confirm the set out.  The work shall be constructed in accordance with the confirmed set out to the line and level and cross-sectional profiles as shown on the drawings.
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: An excavation permit must be issued prior to any excavation commencing.
○ Plant and equipment shall be appropriate for the task.
○ Excavation operations shall not disturb areas outside the limit of excavation
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Excavation completed to required depth to allow placement of the bedding layer
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: All bedding material used shall be as follows:
— Pavement Type 5 Footpath: 100mm layer of 20mm Class 3 Crushed Rock
— Pavement Type 6 Concrete Median: 100mm layer of 20mm Class 3 Crushed Rock
— Pavement Type 7 Concrete Path: 100mm layer of 40mm Class 3 Crushed Rock
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Formwork shall comply with the requirements of AS 3610
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: All steel reinforcement used shall be:
— Pavement Type 5 Footpath: SL72 Steel Mesh
— Pavement Type 6 Concrete Median: SL72 Steel Mesh
— Pavement Type 7 Concrete Path: SL82 Steel Mesh
○ Steel reinforcement shall comply with the requirements of AS/NZS 4671, Minimum cover of 50mm
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Bedding shall be moist but shall have no free water on the surface.
○ Concrete shall not be placed when the air temperature measured at the point of placement is >35°C or <5°C.
○ Temperature of concrete, measured immediately prior to placing, shall not be less than 10°C or greater than 32°C.

○ Concrete shall be thoroughly compacted via continuous tamping and internal vibration. Where concrete is unformed it shall be hand tamped to a smooth surface and screeded in accordance with the construction drawings.
○ Where fresh concrete is being placed against concrete which has taken intial set, a properly formed construction joint must be used.
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Concrete elements shall have a Class 3 surface finish for external surfaces and a Class 4 surface finish for permanenelty hidden surfaces in accordance with AS3610/
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Transverse joints constructed at intervals not exceeding 2.5m.
○ Groove cut 20mm deep and > 5mm wide on exposed surfaces, with vertical cut made through the base of the groove (depth >50mm from surface of section).

○ Expansion joints shall be placed at intervals not exceeding 10 m, on either side of vehicle crossings, at junctions with existing footpaths and shared use paths, at junctions with bridges and around all abutting structures such as pits, utility services, power poles, kerbs and other such features.
The signature below verifies that this ITP has been completed in accordance with the FH’s Quality system Procedures and verifies lot compliance with specifications.
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: The Contractor shall submit the details of the trackless tack coat or tack coat application system proposed to be used in the works.

○ All asphalt mixes proposed for use in the works shall have a mix design registered by Department of Transport and Planning as ‘General’, unless otherwise approved by the Department of Transport and Planning. The registration for all mixes incorporated into the works shall be current at the time of their use. The Contractor shall submit documentation to the Superintendent nominating the asphalt mixes to be supplied no less than 7 days prior to their use.
REFERENCE DOCUMENTS: VicRoads Spec. Cl.407.08, Cl.407.09
INSPECTION/TEST METHOD: Correspondence of receipt of mix design
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: VR approval, ITP Signed
RESPONSIBILITY: Site Engineer/ Asphalt Supervisor / Superintendent
1.2 - Implementation of all measures and controls
FREQUENCY: Prior to commencing any activity
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: All necessary measures and controls are being implemented, that is: QMP, TMP, JSEA, SWMS & WP
REFERENCE DOCUMENTS: QMP, TMP, JSEA, SWMS, WP
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP signed off
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Surface on which asphalt is to be placed is essentially dry and free from puddles and defects (holes, cracks, unstable material and edge irregularities) and loose materials.
REFERENCE DOCUMENTS: VicRoads Spec 407.14, AS2150 10.1, AS2150 10.3, Completed ITP-008/009
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: The majority of the surface area to be paved has a temperature greater than or equal to the following:
○ Base & Intermediate Courses: 5°C for conventional binders or 10°C for PMBs & Class 600
○ Wearing Courses: 10°C for conventional binders or 15°C for PMBs

○ If specified temperatures are unachievable, prior to commencing cold weather placement of asphalt, the Contractor shall submit a job specific cold weather placement management plan to the Superintendent for review.
RESPONSIBILITY: Site Engineer/ Asphalt Supervisor / Superintendent
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Runs to be marked to ensure placement of joints satisfy the following unless otherwise approved by the Client:
○ Transverse Joints Offset from layer to layer by at least 2m
○ Longitudinal Joints Offset from layer to layer by at least 150mm and be within 300mm of the lane line or centre of lane. Wearing course shall be on lane lines.
REFERENCE DOCUMENTS: VicRoads Spec 407.17 (b) & (c) Pavement Drawings
INSPECTION/TEST METHOD: Measure and mark out runs by tape measure or survey

ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: The placement of asphalt on the sub-base or granular base for a new pavement or for an overlay of an existing bituminous surfaced pavement shall not commence until the consent to proceed is obtained from the Client.

○ Prior to the works being carried out, the Contractor shall provide written confirmation of the works that will be undertaken the following day and obtain agreement from the Superintendent to any variation in the design rates of application to those provided under clause 408.13(a).

○ Prior to the works being carried out, the Contractor shall provide written confirmation of the works that will be undertaken the following day and obtain agreement from the Superintendent to any variation in the design rates of application to those provided under clause 408.13(a).
INSPECTION/TEST METHOD: Visual Inspection, Written Confirmation
RESPONSIBILITY: Site Engineer/ Asphalt Supervisor / Superintendent
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Asphalt is not segregated, binder is not separated or does not contain uncoated particles and the temperature from mixing plant is not more than 175°C.
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Ability to locate asphalt test results placed in three dimensions i.e. start/end chainage, offset/lane and layer
REFERENCE DOCUMENTS: Fulton Hogan Quality Plan
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: Daily Lot Record
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Thickness of asphalt layer conforms to asphalt thickness on drawings or specifications
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: Dips using ruler or dip stick
FREQUENCY: During paving and after final roll
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: The finished surface of asphalt wearing course shall be of uniform appearance, free of dragged areas, cracks, open textured patches and roller marks
○ Rectification of surface levels shall not commence until approval to proceed is obtained from the Superintendent.
FREQUENCY: During paving and after final roll
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: The edge of the wearing course shall be either flush with or not more than 5 mm above the lip of the channel unless otherwise specified
2.7 - Alignment of layers not placed against concrete edge
FREQUENCY: During paving and at completion of work
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: The edge of asphalt layers shall not be more than 50mm inside nor more than 100mm outside, the designed offset from centreline or design line.
○ The rate of change of offset of the edge of layer shall not be greater than 25mm in 10m
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: For layers <50mm, if characteristic density ratio is:
— 91.0% to 93.9% Lot may be accepted at reduced rate
○ For layers ≥50mm, if characteristic thickness is:
— 91.0% to 95.9% Lot may be accepted at reduced rate
RESPONSIBILITY: Site Engineer/ FH Lab Technician
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Individual departures from design not to exceed ±5mm with a standard deviation of no greater than 8mm

ITP-008 - Drilling and Setting of Dowel Bars
template name: ITP-008 - Drilling and Setting of Dowel Bars

name: ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Ensure that all employees and subcontractors are using the complete set of the correct and most current drawings.
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP Signed
1.2 - Safety measures are in place, SWMS undertaken
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: As per Fulton Hogan Safety Strategy. All personnel on site to have signed onto relevant SWMS before commencing work.
REFERENCE DOCUMENTS: Health and Safety Coordination Plan
1.3 - Confirm understanding of current EMP & ECP related to the work area and that all prescribed environmental controls are in place
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: All environmental measures to be implemented as per current EMP and local authorities. Sediment control measures to be installed and protected vegetation to be clearly identified
INSPECTION/TEST METHOD: Document review & Site inspection
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP Signed
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Current GPP signed and specific for the area where works will be executed.
INSPECTION/TEST METHOD: Document review & Site inspection
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: Excavation Permit Signed
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: GPR Scan concrete deck to locate the upper bent of the existing shear ligatures of the existing RC beam. The scan shall mark also the deck reinforcement on top of concrete deck.
○ Spacing of dowel bars can be adjusted by 25mm from specificied locations in the drawings to avoid cutting existing bars.
INSPECTION/TEST METHOD: Document Review & Site Inspection
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP Signed

ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Drill an initial pilot hole 10mm nominal diameter at specified location from beam end. If reinforcement encountered, stop drilling immediately and attempt another pilot hole approximately 25mm longitudinally and laterally away from the first pilot hole in parallel direction to the existing beam. If reinforcement is still encountered, use the same offsets in the opposite direction until a clear hole is obtained.

○ A succesful pilot hole is obtained when a 150mm drill hole does not enounter reinforcement. Once a successful pilot hole is obtained, drill hole to required depth and diameter shown on the drawings and use for the first dowel bar.
REFERENCE DOCUMENTS: Design IFC Drawings, Dowel Hole Drilling Procedure
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP Signed
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Locate subsequent drill holes in the same longitudinal alignment as first dowel bar. If reinforcement is encountered, repeat procedure stated in item 2.2.
○ Use percussion drills only for dowel hole. Coring is strictly prohibited.
REFERENCE DOCUMENTS: Design IFC Drawings, Dowel Hole Drilling Procedure
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP Signed
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Ensure all holes are cleaned in accordance with the manufacturer's installation instructions. This must include the following as a minimum:
○ Air flush twice at the specified pressure.
○ Air flush twice at the specified pressure.

○ Fingertip test the hole surface for dust, and if dust is still present, brush clean and air-flush until all dust is removed. Ensure hole is clean and free of debris, dust particles, oils and other contaminants over its full depth.
REFERENCE DOCUMENTS: VicRoads Spec. 680.08 Manufacturer's Specification
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP Signed

ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Prior to proceeding with the installation of all dowels bars, the trial system installation shall be witnessed by the superintendent and the outcomes reviewed and approved by the Superintendent.
FREQUENCY: Prior to commencing this work
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Ensure materials being used are in accordance with standard specifications and design drawings.
○ Installation to be undertaken in accordance with manufacturer's specifications.
○ Seal all unused drill holes prior to constructiing deck concrete by filling with 'Hilti' HIT-RE 500 as per manufacturer's specifications.
REFERENCE DOCUMENTS: Manufacturer's Specification, Design IFC Drawings

ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: The Contractor shall submit for review by the Superintendent a quality procedure / work method statement for the construction of the piles not less than 4 weeks prior to the commencement of the piling works. Piling works shall not take place until the quality procedure has been reviewed and approved by the Superintendent.
REFERENCE DOCUMENTS: VicRoads Sec.610.18 Quality Procedure
FREQUENCY: Prior to commencing any activity
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Current Excavation Permit signed and specific for to the area where works will be execxuted.
FREQUENCY: Prior to commencing any activity
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: The contractor shall submit the concrete mix design details for review by the Superintendent not less than 4 weeks prior to the placement of concrete.
○ Manufacturers and suppliers of steel reinforcement materials must be in posession of a current certificate of approval, issued by the ACRS.
○ Reinforcement shall be checked upon delivery and placed on timbers adjacent to site fixing.
○ Ensure that materials on-site are sufficient for the completion of works.
REFERENCE DOCUMENTS: Design Drawings, VicRoads Standard Section 610 & 611
INSPECTION/TEST METHOD: Visual Inspection/ Document Review
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: ITP Signed, Test Certificates, Material Data Sheets.
FREQUENCY: Prior to commencing any activity

ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Ensure any underground service locations have been identified and marker on-site. Ensure any required approvals/permits have been received by service authorities prior to commencing works.
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: The work shall be constructed in accordance with the confirmed set out to the line and level and cross-sectional profiles as shown on the drawings.
REFERENCE DOCUMENTS: Design Drawings & Survey Data
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: The work shall be constructed in accordance with the confirmed set out to the line and level and cross-sectional profiles as shown on the drawings.
REFERENCE DOCUMENTS: Design Drawings & Survey Data
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: No pile construction shall be commenced within 2.5m clear distance of a newly cast pile until the concrete  in the pile has attained the strength of 15 Mpa.

ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: The construction of the bored piles shall be carried out in the presence of a geotechnical engineer with appropriate experience to confirm that the founding materials at the piling locations are of a strength to satisfy the design assumptions. The geotechnical engineer engaged by the contractor shall be independent of the piling sub-contractor.

ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: The temporary casing (where used) shall not be removed, nor shall reinforcement and/or concrete be placed until the pile walls and base have been inspected by the Superintendent and that the inspection has confirmed that the geotechnical strength of the materials in the pile wall base have satisfied the design assumptions.
RESPONSIBILITY: Project Engineer/ Geotechnical Engineer/ Superintendent

ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Reinforcement and/or concrete shall not be placed until the proposed method of removing mud, loose rock or similar materials, and the method of placement of concrete under water has been reviewed by the Superintendent.
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Concrete placed under water shall be self compacting concrete (SCC) in accordance with the requirements of clause 610.07, clause 610.13 and clause 610.18(c).

○ The outlet of the tremie pipe or pump discharge hose shall not be lifted from the bottom of the hole until the hole has been filled with a minimum of 2m depth of concrete. Thereafter, concreting shall be kept a minimum of 2m below the top surface of the concrete at all times and the Contractor shall continuously monitor and ensure that the 2m depth of embedment is to be maintained at all time.
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Concrete shall not be placed in bored piles, under water or in a dry bore until the propose method of placement of concrete has been approved by the Superintendent.

ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: All testing shall be undertaken by a prequalified consultant in accordance with the VicRoads scheme for prequalification and approval of the Superintendent. The consultant shall be independent of the piling contractor. The contractor shall provide details of the pile testing consultant to the Superintendent for review at least 2 weeks prior to the testing.
FREQUENCY: First six piles followed by every third pile thereafter.

ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: All testing shall be undertaken by a prequalified consultant in accordance with the VicRoads scheme for prequalification and approval of the Superintendent. The consultant shall be independent of the piling contractor.
○ Raw data of pile integrity testing shall be provided to the Superintendent within 48 hours of request of the Superintendent,

ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: The assessment of the cracked concrete structure shall be undertaken by a technical specialist with a minimum of 5 years practical experience in the diagnostic assessment and investigation of concrete structures.
RESPONSIBILITY: Project Engineer/ Superintendent / Technical Specialist

ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: The contractor shall submit the concrete mix design details for review by the Superintendent not less than 4 weeks prior to the placement of concrete. This shall include full details of the proposed methods of curing.

○ Manufacturers and suppliers of steel reinforcement materials must be in posession of a current certificate of approval, issued by the ACRS. All reinforcement must be covered by the long-term quality level of AS/NZS 4671
○ Reinforcement shall be checked upon delivery and placed on timbers adjacent to site fixing.
○ Ensure that materials on-site are sufficient for the completion of works.
REFERENCE DOCUMENTS: Design Drawings, VicRoads Spec. 610 & 611
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: ITP Signed, Test Certificates, Material Data Sheets.
FREQUENCY: Prior to commencing any activity
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: The Contractor shall submit to the Superintendent for review the following:
— Full details of the proposed hot or cold weather concreting procedure, not less than two weeks prior to placement of concrete if required.
— Detailed WMS, ITPs, & Checklists for all concrete construction works not less than 4 weeks prior to the placement of concrete.
— Full details of the proposed methods of curing, as part of the concrete mix design submission, not less than 4 weeks prior to placement of concrete.
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: ITP Signed, Submitted Documentation
FREQUENCY: Prior to construction of formwork (if required)
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: The requirement for formwork design shall be in accordance with VicRoads Sepcification 614 Table 614.041.
○ Where formwork is required, the proof engineering certificate of compliance shall be forwarded to the Superintendent as least two days prior to the construction of any formwork.
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: ITP Signed, Submitted Documentation
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: The work shall be constructed in accordance with the confirmed set out to the line and level and cross-sectional profiles as shown on the drawings.
REFERENCE DOCUMENTS: Design Drawings & Survey Data
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Ensure steel reinforcement complies with the relevant specification and design drawings.
○ Reinforcement placement shall be coordinated with formwork erection such that is can be placed to the correct size, location, diameter, number and spacing as shown on the drawings.

○ If required, re-bending of steel reinforcement shall not commence until the procedure has been reviewed and approved by  the Superintendent, and shall be witnessed by the Superintendent's representative.

○ Splices in reinforcement shall be made only in the position shown on the drawings or as otherwise approved by the superintendent. Welding of splices in steel reinforcement, including to other steelwork and to continuity bar reinforcement, shall not commmence until the welding procedure has been qualified and reviewed by the Superintendent.
○ Ensure reinforcement to be embedded shall be free of mortar, oil, dirt, rust, grease, paint, tar or any other contaminants.
○ Ensure 70mm cover on all steel reinforcement unless noted otherwise on the design drawings.

ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Formwork, including supporting systems, shall be constructed in a fashion that ensures the specified quality of concrete finish is achieved. Forms shall be clean and free of majore surface defects.

○ Formwork shall be constructed and shall be sufficient stiffness to tolerate the rate of concrete placement and high frequency vibration, and shall be of uniform stiffness to avoid causing varying vibration aplitudes over the formwork surfaces during compaction of concrete.
○ Formwork shall not be placed in locations where steel reinforcement and other fixtures cannot be inspected and/or will be left open until inspections have been completed.
○ The application of any load shall not proceed until the signed Certificate of Compliance - Formwork Inspection of the constructed formwork has been reviewd and accepted by the the Superintendent.
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: ITP Signed / Certificate of Compliance - Formwork Inspection
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Ensure that the forms, reinforcement, any stressing materials and embedments has been checked against the specifciation and design drawings by the Superintendent.
○ All foreign material has been completely removed from the forms.
○ Air and concrete temperatures shall be recorded. Concrete shall only be placed under the following conditions:

○ Concrete shall be placed from a height not exceeding 2m. Concrete pumping shall be used where access is restricted. Prior to the commencement of placing concrete by pumping, the initial discharge of concrete shall be pumped to waste until a consistent workable mix is discharged.
○ In continuous concrete pours the maximum time lag between truck loads on site shall not exceed 25 minutes.
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: All concrete batches (truckloads) used in the works shall be traceable from the batch plant to its general location in the structure by a unique lot number.
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: ITP Signed, Concrete Delivery Dockets

ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Formwork and formwork supports shall not be disturbed or adjusted during the concreting operation and shall remain in position and undisturbed until the minimum removal times given in VicRoads Table 610.251 have elapsed, after completion of the placing of concrete.
○ If drilling into newly constructed concrete members, the drilling procedure and drill locations shall be submitted for approval by the Superintendent.
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Ensure the method and period of curing is in accordance with specifications agreed with the client.
○ The contractor shall ensure that records of temperature monitoring during the curing period are available for review by the Superintendent.
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Dimensional tolerances shall be checked against the requirements in accordance with specications agreed with the client.
○ The concrete shall be inspected for quality of finish and compliance with the surface class requirements.

ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: The assessment of the cracked concrete structure shall be undertaken by a technical specialist with a minimum of 5 years practical experience in the diagnostic assessment and investigation of concrete structures.
RESPONSIBILITY: Site Engineer/ Site Foreman / Superintendent / Technical Specialist
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Early loading and trafficking of bridge decks, concrete deck overlays and approach slabs shall not proceed until:
(i) the Contractor’s early loading and trafficking quality procedure and inspection and test plan(s) have been reviewed by the Superintendent

(ii) the evidence that the minimum periods stated in this clause have been satisfied and maturity testing, temperature monitoring and compressive strength test results have been reviewed by the Superintendent.

○ Lane closures and and speed restrictions shall not be removed until PPV measurements, matuirty testing, temperature monitoring and compressive strength test results have been reviewed by the Superintendent.
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: All concrete shall be sampled and tested in accordance with AS 1012.
○ The minimum number of test samples shall be in accordance with Table 610.161 in the VicRoads Standard.
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: Concrete Test Results
